row.header: What did you do this past week?
row.text: This past week, I discovered some new hidden works to be done for my project at work, so the project is going to take quite a bit longer than expected. Other than that, I've spent a lot of time studying for SWE exam on Thursday. I think that I did fairly well, just not as well as I hoped for. However, I'll be sure to stay on top of my quizzes and projects to make up for that points lost. I also went to ACL over the weekend. It was quite an experience for me.
Some assignments are given out for all my classes already. I really need to push myself to get started on those because it will all be due on the weekend of Halloween, which I will be out of town.

row.header: What will you do next week?
row.text: This coming week, I will be doing a lot of homework for this and the week after as well. I have another music festival to go to during Halloween weekend, so I need to get myself ready for it and not lack behind academically.

row.header: What's my experience of the class?
row.text: The way Prof Downing went over the difference in between */** in function definition and function call really was helpful to me. It gave me a basic understanding of the difference functionalities of these two symbols in two different context. I tried to read further about it through python documentation, and I realized that there are a lot more details and precautions. I really enjoyed lectures this past week.

My pick-of-the-week is Gitlab. As an open-source project, GitLab provides many powerful development tools like version control or Agile board, all with beautiful and user-friendly interface. You guys should check it out!
